# imageEdgeInsets

**Instance Property**

The inset or outset margins for the rectangle around the button’s image.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var imageEdgeInsets: UIEdgeInsets { get set }
```

## Discussion

Use this property to resize and reposition the effective drawing rectangle for the button image. You can specify a different value for each of the four insets (top, left, bottom, right). A positive value shrinks, or insets, that edge—moving it closer to the center of the button. A negative value expands, or outsets, that edge. Use the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIEdgeInsets/init(top:left:bottom:right:)-1s1t9] function to construct a value for this property. The default value is [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIEdgeInsets/zero].

This property is used only for positioning the image during layout. The button does not use this property to determine [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIView/intrinsicContentSize] and [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIView/sizeThatFits(_:)].

## Edge insets

- **contentEdgeInsets**: The inset or outset margins for the rectangle surrounding all of the button’s content.
- **titleEdgeInsets**: The inset or outset margins for the rectangle around the button’s title text.
